day1.title: National Corn on the Cob Day
facts: Corn is one of the most widely grown crops in the world, with the United States being the largest producer.
Corn on the cob is a popular summer treat, often enjoyed at barbecues and picnics.
Corn can be eaten in various forms, including boiled, grilled, or roasted.

day2.title: National German Chocolate Cake Day
facts: German chocolate cake is named after Samuel German, who developed a type of dark baking chocolate for the Baker's Chocolate Company.
The cake is known for its rich layers of chocolate cake, coconut, and pecan frosting.
Despite its name, German chocolate cake is an American creation, not a German one.

day3.title: King Kamehameha Day
facts: King Kamehameha Day is a public holiday in Hawaii, celebrated on June 11th to honor King Kamehameha the Great.
King Kamehameha is known for uniting the Hawaiian Islands into one royal kingdom in 1810.
The holiday is marked by various festivities, including parades, hula performances, and lei draping ceremonies.
